meta_description: Virginia MOCA is on the move! We are closed and will reopen to the public in April 2026 at our new home on the campus of Virginia Wesleyan University.
admission_text:
# Plan Your Visit

# Visit¬

**WELCOME!**

**ADMISSION INFORMATION:**

Virginia MOCA Museum members are always free. [Learn more](https://virginiamoca.org/memberships) and become a supporter.

**In-state Admission**

Virginia Residents: FREE  
Children under 12: FREE

Free admission for Virginia residents is generously funded by Sentara and The Sokol Family Foundation

**Out-of-state Admission**

Non-residents of Virginia: $16.50  
Children under 12: FREE

**Discounted Admission***

Adults 65+, Active Military, First Responders, Teachers, and Students: $11

*Must present ID to qualify.

**Programs and Reciprocal Memberships***

Museums for All, year round: Free

Virginia MOCA is proud to partner with [Museums for All](https://museums4all.org/), to offer free admission with the presentation of one Electronic Benefits Transfer (EBT) card and photo ID for up to four individuals within the same group. Children 12 and under are always free.

Blue Star Museums, May 17–September 1, 2025: Free

The [Blue Star Museums](https://www.arts.gov/initiatives/blue-star-museums) free admission program is available for those currently serving in the United States Military—Air Force, Army, Coast Guard, Marine Corps, Navy, and Space Force, members of the Reserves, National Guard, U.S. Public Health Commissioned Corps, NOAA Commissioned Corps, and up to five family members. Qualified members must show military ID for entrance into a participating Blue Star Museum.

accessibility_text:
## Accessibility¬

We strive to make the art experience welcoming to everyone and accessible in many forms.

**DIFFICULTY STANDING?**  
We have portable gallery chairs you can carry with you—they weigh less than 2 pounds! The Museum is also wheelchair accessible. A couple non-motorized wheelchairs are available for loan on a first-come-first-served basis.

**VISION IMPAIRMENT?**  
Audio tours are available for every exhibition and feature a large selection of the works. We also have large-print labels available.

**SENSORY NEEDS?**  
In partnership with [Kulture City](https://venue.kulturecity.org/venues/virginia-museum-of-contemporary-art), we have sensory bags available for loan at the Welcome Desk. The bags are filled with items that can help lessen sensory overload and also engage. We also created our very own [Social Story](https://venue.kulturecity.org/venues/virginia-museum-of-contemporary-art) to aid individuals in learning how to navigate their visit to Virginia MOCA.

## Upcoming Exhibitions¬

[](https://virginiamoca.org/exhibitions/nina-chanel-abney-the-pursuit-of-happiness/)

### Nina Chanel Abney: The Pursuit of Happiness 

#### April 18, 2026-August 16, 2026

Virginia MOCA opens its new home with a landmark solo exhibition by Nina Chanel Abney, one of the most incisive voices in contemporary art. _The Pursuit of Happiness_ brings together monumental paintings, collages, sculpture, and an immersive installation that confront how we imagine joy, struggle, and survival in a time of global uncertainty.

[](https://virginiamoca.org/exhibitions/seamless-art-and-design/)

### Seamless: Art and Design 

#### April 18, 2026-August 16, 2026

_Seamless: Art and Design_ brings together artists who are also designers, many of whom are widely recognized for shaping contemporary visual culture.
